reviews.text: The castle is awesome and there's tons of information in English breaking down all of the interesting architectural details. The castle is very much left as is inside so you can really get a feel for the building. Great views from the top and cherry blossoms in early April.
I prefer this over hemeji. Just the lack of crowds. So happy they saved this beauty.

Beautiful from the outside, especially with lanterns, and cherry blossoms right around the corner. The inside offers plenty of information on the history of the castle. The view at the top isn't that impressive, though.

It wasn’t a good weather when we got there so I guess we could not see the best of this old castle.  However  there was a sense of its own beauty even though it was cloudy and a bit of rainy.

It didn’t  take that long to walk around the castle.  When we got out of the castle the raining stopped and we could see a beautiful blue sky.  

I’m sure it would have a fantastic view when it got all of cherry blossoms in spring.

Well preserved antique castle. I liked how original the interior was being kept. You can clearly see the amazing structures designed to withstand the massive construction for so many years. The climb to the top might be a little tiring since the stairs are really steep! But the calming scenes of the city and the comforting cool breeze will definitely be worth the effort!

This museum was incredible! They have all kinds of interesting artifacts from times past in Japan, they also have a sweet shop, and a tea room. Before you enter the Sweet Shop, there are two giant sculptures made entirely out of Japanese sweets! They're very beautiful.

Get to see Samurai traditional costume and top view of castle from museum window. At exit do check huge drums which they does play marching in streets of Matsue in month of April a traditional Matsurri event.
A slideshow using Matsue's old pictures can enjoy a nostalgic atmosphere.

we visited this museum as a prelude to visting the matsue castle. they have a small but high quality collection of local artefacts arranged to present the history of matsue castle. there is an english audio guide available for free as well discount tickets for non japanese. You can get a combo ticket for museum and castle. they have regular art exhibitions. there is an excellent coffee shop and gift shop.
Small but nicely organized and curated history of the Matsue region.
It's a very special experience!

An interesting look into the life and times of author Lafcadio Hearn (Koizumi Yakumo) as well as the architecture of a Meiji Era Japanese home.  They even sell manga telling (a truncated part of) his life story here.
For foreigners who enjoy reading Lafcadio Hearn (Koizumi Yakumo) you will have to visit this museum / his home.  It has all of his books, artifacts and great stories about his life.
パトリック・ラフカディオ・ハーンが約５ヶ月間を過ごした松江の住居。当時のままで保存されている唯一の建物です。

怪談の作者 ラフカディオ･ハーンを知らない人は興味が無いと思いますが、それでも行ったらそこそこ面白いと思います。
意外なし生涯と外国にも妖怪のっぺらぼうがいることが分かりました！
Just a few old traditional houses associated with samurai. Unless you are keen on their lifestyle and history, can give this place a miss.

松江城の北側、塩見縄手の一角に、江戸時代に建てられた武士の家が今も残っています。家族用と来客用で別々に造られた玄関、小さくても落ち着いた造りの茶室などが、かつての武士の暮らしをしのばせます。
庭から斜面を階段で登って行くと、松江のお祭りで披露される太鼓「鼕(とう)」の展示場もあります。

水燈路の開催される10月にいってきました。夜の写真を掲載します。

日中とは違った雰囲気を醸し出す夜の武家屋敷は、水燈路の期間中という事もあり、電飾されてとても綺麗でした。

人でも多く、武家屋敷内にあるお店の多くのお客さんで賑わっていました。

ちょうどこの日、山陰で活躍中のモデルスタジオミューズさんが、松本アキオ氏プロデュースのショーを開催されていました。

その事もあり、武家屋敷内は凄い熱気を感じました。

こういった施設を、今回のように活用されると、施設の注目度アップはもちろん、地元の人たちが足を運ぶきっかけになるのではないかと思いました。

これからも武家屋敷でこういったイベントをどんどん実施して欲しいです。

近く駐車場がないので、、、どこか駐車場ないかな、、、
昔のままの町並みが残っていて、風情があります。
割とこじんまりとしていました。とても落ち着くところです。
A very beautiful and quiet temple, with little tourist and you will find peace of mind here。
Can enjoy silent. looks like decade shrine, gate, stone paving, you can see what you've never seen before.
I loved how there were hardly any people, so you can fully appreciate the temple structures and grounds. The giant turtle is a must-see. Very unusual and noble looking.
This is yet another beautiful temple and it's close to Matsue Castle.

松江藩松平ゆかりの地。歴代の藩主の功罪を知って訪れると、うなるものあり。
松江城下有数のアジサイの名所。雨降りと雨上がりは石畳が滑ります&段差も豊富です。

Famous power spot to pray for love :)
Was touched by the holy atmosphere the Shrine owns. They have beautiful Omamoris too.
Beautiful little temple in Matsue. Worth a visit!
The mirror pond is great...put a 10/100yen coin on the floating paper and u will see the msg. ^^ almost all ppls come for this..
Very nice Powerspot. And a special form of a omamori 😉
A must see spot when you come to Matsue. Plenty of parking and there is a cafe down the street. You can wish for love.

Nice place to sit, relax and hang around. 

Closes usually at 5.30 pm in Summer uptill september then after 4.30 pm uptill March.

Check events on particular day you visit. 

We group of guys just had glimpse of band of Shimane and it was really awesome.
Ilovethisplace🌹❤🍀🌱
Local garden that you will want to spend an hour at. They have a craft sale a few times a year.

静かで、くつろげる場所です。
こんな素敵な庭園を無料で味わわせてもらえて、本当に感謝です。作業員の方々、大切に手入れしてくれてありがとうございます🌺
冬でもキレイな花が丹精込めて育てられて、冬のバラが見頃でした。１５分から３０分もあれば園内を一周でき、松江しんじ湖温泉駅から一駅とアクセスもよいので、ちょっとした空き時間に行くのもありです。何よりも無料で鑑賞させてもらうことができ大変ありがたかったです。

A really beautiful garden with some local competition sculptures displayed in various locations. The area near the entrance into the garden looks the best! They also have a tulip garden which also looks amazing around April.

Alas we missed seeing the garden in Spring with the peonies, but the night time illumination more than made up for the disappointment.  A veteran of the Hiroshima illumination, my fiancee and I thought we'd skip it last year.  A friend recommended Yushien.

It was very beautifully lit, and had some nice lighting designs.

Also had an interesting gift shop.
worth to visit.  The manager has taken a lot effort to maintain its beautiful garden.
Very nice. I love it
Very good~^^

The castle is awesome and there's tons of information in English breaking down all of the interesting architectural details. The castle is very much left as is inside so you can really get a feel for the building. Great views from the top and cherry blossoms in early April.
I prefer this over hemeji. Just the lack of crowds. So happy they saved this beauty.

Beautiful from the outside, especially with lanterns, and cherry blossoms right around the corner. The inside offers plenty of information on the history of the castle. The view at the top isn't that impressive, though.

It wasn’t a good weather when we got there so I guess we could not see the best of this old castle.  However  there was a sense of its own beauty even though it was cloudy and a bit of rainy.

It didn’t  take that long to walk around the castle.  When we got out of the castle the raining stopped and we could see a beautiful blue sky.  

I’m sure it would have a fantastic view when it got all of cherry blossoms in spring.

Well preserved antique castle. I liked how original the interior was being kept. You can clearly see the amazing structures designed to withstand the massive construction for so many years. The climb to the top might be a little tiring since the stairs are really steep! But the calming scenes of the city and the comforting cool breeze will definitely be worth the effort!
It is a very beautiful place~
Superb traditional soba restaurant in a beautiful setting. Kind service.
I had a simple cold soba (serve over three plates), with sauce and toppings. Along with a beer. Delish! Beautiful surroundings.
Nice place, Best food

I found out about this place from a client who hails from Matsue. Soba is the name of the game here. The garden, historic building all add to the experience. The walls are filled with Japanese celebrities who ate here. Great lunch after visiting Matsue Castle! ( I got 3 bowls of soba set. Yo can also get 5..7.. can't leave hungry)
Amazing coffee and they have a few interesting winter options. Well for food there is none for vegetarians on the menu..but the kind staff did prepare a veg sandwich. The cakes are yum
Delicious coffee, great breakfast and you can buy beans there for home brewing

The guy runs this place is extremely passionate about coffee. He roasts his own beans, and is a champion barista. His espresso drinks are EXCELLENT.
I often get his cappuccino here.

Also he used to a pastry chef, so definitely try the tiramisu!
スタッフの雰囲気もよく、居心地良かった。コーヒーや紅茶もたくさん種類があって選ぶのに迷います。  野イチゴのケーキも美味しかった😃  また行ってみたいとこです。
東京、大阪とか色々有名店巡ったけどエスプレッソが一番美味い。

肉とワインを楽しんで欲しい！

2019年2月に移転オープン。
前よりこじんまりして、良い感じになった。
カウンター主体の店になり、カジュアル感が増して、以前より気軽に立ち寄れる雰囲気に。

肉料理が秀逸。鴨、牛モモ、あとはジビエの鹿や猪などはめちゃ旨い。
ハーブは自家菜園で栽培している
ワインのチョイスも素敵。

＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊＊
評価の基準
★5 神店、何度もリピートする店、素晴らしい体験が出来る店。無条件でお勧めしたい店

★4 商品、サービスとコストが見合った良店、人にお勧めしたい店

★3 評価に値する店

★2 課題をクリアすればさらに良くなると思われる店

★1 評価に値しない店。二度と訪れたくない店。
美味しいワイン🍷と料理は心も和みます〜
美味しい料理と様々なワインが頂けます。CPはちょっと悪いかな～。
松江一番のイタリアンです
wide range of food

旅行先でパスタが食べたいと言われ、グーグルマップで検索して入店。

「いくらとスジコと明太子のクリームパスタ」

ランチのセットサラダ、パンは美味しかった。
ドレッシングは出汁が入っているようで、美味しい。

大盛を注文したが、運ばれてきたのは普通盛。
確認すると間違えておられたようで、大盛になって戻ってきた。
どうやってすぐに大盛になったんだろう？
スジコが多いからか、塩辛い。
魚卵がのってる上は冷たく、下は温かい。
結果、ぬるくなる。

家族４人で行き、子ども(小１)も１セット頼んだが、食べきれなかった。
キッズプレートがあることは教えてくださったが、ランチ１セットの量が多いことももう少し教えて欲しかった。
ランチ700円は3種類。パンとサラダ付き大変美味しくてお得❗松江での外食の半分はここかも⁉
ペアランチを頼んで二人でシェアするので、ピザやパスタを選んで食べれます。１人1300円で、サラダやデザート飲み物もあるので、お得でした。
独特な味。ウーシャンフェンかな？ピザにもミートソースにも

After a 10 day road trip around Egypt we spent our last day in Cairo at this hotel. It was bliss. They upgraded us to a suite, which was large, with two bathrooms and a great view. The room service breakfast was delicious and plentiful, and the bed was a pleasure to sleep in. The best part was the spa on the rooftop, with fresh scented aromatic candles burning along the entrance hallway; comfy plush bathrobes and slippers and a hot tub (one for men and one for women). Definitely have a hot drink and sweet at the lobby café. They make amazing chocolate creations, both to eat and to drink.

Staff is unbelievably kind, helpful and devoted. 

I visited most of the 5* hotels in this area (after 2 weeks of being in Cairo) and experienced their lobby, restaurants, pool etc and I can say without a doubt that the Kempinski is the one that gets a 10 on all checkmarks. 

Definitely is my go to hotel in Cairo for my next trips..thank you to the management for doing such a great job with the staff!

Its less than the average 5 Stars regarding the entrance, design and breakfast buffet. The team starting from the security reaching to the rooftop is very kind, helpful and welcoming. Regarding the prices i found it a little bit cheaper comparing to neighbour 5 stars hotels

Rooms are ok although sometimes they smell (smoke) breakfast is good! I originally gave three stars to the hotel but I just upgraded it to 4. Why? Because the staff answered to my comment and very politely promised that they will take better care of the rooms to avoid smoke smell. This is fantastic, well done!

Very enjoyable stay at this hotel, my wife and I booked four nights there and we were pleased with the service and the staff from the reception to the house keeping. 
The buffet is excellent and great variety of food, the service in the breakfast restaurant was excellent, and it is worth mentioning that we have not noticed any of the waiters pushing for tipping.

We come across minor problems with the shower,  one of the managers, a lady by the name of Aya, arranged a quick fix.

In general we were very pleased with the hotel and staff. 

Highly recommended.
